comments.body: In other places, the helper is set as a class property. Do you have recommendations about it?

I think the helpers need some more discussion. Many of them performs same thing like create a bucket or delete a bucket, so maybe it's worth to rethink our overall approach. If we are going to migrate to pytest then helpers should be replaced by fixtures.
Ok. We can do it in separate PR.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +35,39 @@    def tearDown(self):
        # Delete instances just in case the test failed and did not cleanup after itself
        SQL_QUERY_TEST_HELPER.delete_instances(instance_suffix="-failover-replica")
        SQL_QUERY_TEST_HELPER.delete_instances(instance_suffix="-read-replica")
        SQL_QUERY_TEST_HELPER.delete_instances()
